oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Influence of finite volume and magnetic field effects on the QCD phase diagram
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Magdy, Niseem
Csanád, M.
Lacey, Roy A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nuclear Theory
High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Polyakov linear sigma model (PLSM) is used to investigate the respective influence of a finite volume and a magnetic field on the quark-hadron phase boundary in the plane of baryon chemical potential ($\mu_{B}$) vs. temperature ($T$) of the QCD phase diagram. The calculated results indicate sizable shifts of the quark-hadron phase boundary to lower values of $(\mu_{B}~\text{and}~T)$ for increasing magnetic field strength, and an opposite shift to higher values of $(\mu_{B}~\text{and}~T)$ for decreasing system volume. Such shifts could have important implications for extraction of the thermodynamic properties of the QCD phase diagram from heavy ion data.
